content:
Hello,
I am new to fhir. I needed to ask you how can i create a fhir resources? I came across the hapi library. But i am not sure how to use it for creating resource.
Hi Hareem, See the FHIR Specification home page for an introduction to many of these topics.

Hi Eric, I am looking into it. And while making the local repository at my server. I need to install apache tomcat. So while doing it, there are some installations problems. It says all environment variables are to be added in the "seteny.sh" file. And then it says "By default the setenv script file is absent." Any idea how to generate this file? because it no where how to write it
@Hareem Mughis There is HAPI channel. You can get help with environment setup there. https://chat.fhir.org/#narrow/stream/hapi

Hi @Hareem Mughis , maybe you could provide more detail on what you are trying to accomplish. If you want to stand up a FHIR server on your own computer, the HAPI FHIR CLI is a much easier way to do that: http://hapifhir.io/doc_cli.html
